Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Prognostic Model Development for Bladder Cancer Patients with Prior Tumors

Objective.evidence: This study aims to examine the clinical characteristics of bladder cancer patients with a history of prior malignancies and develop a prognostic model using SEER database data.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was overall survival, measured from diagnosis to death.

Number_Analysed.evidence: A total of 12,260 bladder cancer patients were analyzed, including 8,959 with no prior tumor history and 3,301 with a history of previous tumors.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The mean survival duration for patients with a prior tumor history was 56.04 months, significantly lower than 70.28 months for those without (P<0.001).
